lenders.name: Maggie

lenders.occupational_info: I am a full time student and single mom. I plan to teach high school English.

lenders.name: Lyn
lenders.loan_because: I'm blessed to live where I do, with a good job. Loaning a small amount can make such a huge difference to a person, and make their lives so much better - why would I NOT loan?
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a library, helping people find the information they need and making sure they go away with what they wanted when they came in.

lenders.name: Christian

People in different countries should connect and work together through the internet to accomplish common goals.

lenders.name: Susanna
lenders.loan_because:
It's a small thing - just $25 to assist another woman to make a better life for herself and her family. 

In the normal course of events I would never even know of these women and how they courageously struggle to raise themselves from poverty.
lenders.occupational_info:
OK, so I can't change the world. I would prefer if all the war budgets aimed at slaughtering each other were used instead to create a world where  everyone had proper food,  housing, education and health care. A world where social justice for all was the norm. But it's not. 

Making a micro loan through Kiva is one small action I can take. One thing I CAN do.

I'm a member of the Red Hats on the Yarra group, we  make loans to women who don't have the resources which we take for granted.  

Do yourself a favour and join us. You don't have to be a Red Hatter, you don't even have to live in Melbourne! All you need is a heart  - and the vision to see that Kiva is NOT a charity but a self-help scheme.

Providing support to entrepreneurs in developing countries will help to stimulate their local economy and may lead to the creation of jobs. This would lead to an improvement in the lives of people in the area and not just for the entrepreneur themselves. I believe that supporting entrepreneurs would be the catalyst needed for longer term economic change.

lenders.name: Ruth

lenders.name: Will
lenders.loan_because:
Kiva is Win-Win on steroids!

Kiva personally permits me 
(1) to flexibly and effectively battle poverty
(2) one on one 
(3) funding only the needy I can afford 
(4) using a revolving account
(5) at little or no cost or even risk to me.  

Kiva communily 
(5) builds and betters humanity 
(6) with small, humble endeavers 
(7) that enable my entrepreneurs to achieve a successful future for all.  

Since 2008, the meager $1407 I have invested has financed more than 160 loans--some as the sole source--measurably bettering the lives of hundreds of the most needy and enterprising. I only regret that I cannot command more resources to personally brighten the eyes of every Kiva prospect I view who seeks only a very humble investment to resurrect his/her life one step at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired, disabled and modestly alone in a small home by the sea. How privileged I am to individually and intimately lighten--however slight--the dark cross of poverty from the shoulders of my entrepreneurs whose burdens I have never experienced.

lenders.name: cathy
lenders.loan_because: We are all connected.

lenders.occupational_info: My work is manufacturing cosmetics. I also have website, sales, and marketing resonsibilities of the business.

lenders.name: Elmo
lenders.loan_because: Why not?
lenders.occupational_info: Uhmmm.... complicated? not too much, just put some hundreds of computers over there, plug some cables... and make them work together. That way, they will make calculations in a coordinated way and collaborating... and that saves time!!! and time is gold!!!

lenders.name: Iñaki
lenders.loan_because: To promote a beautiful and powerful project (Kiva). It's also a matter of justice; not only the rich should have access to finance.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Social Science student, and a Engineer working both as Patent Officer and Staff Representative/Unionist. I examine potential inventions and decide whether they make a substantial contribution to the state of the art and deserve a patent. In the second facet of my work, I make sure the voice of the staff is heard by management.

lenders.name: Dieter
lenders.loan_because: I like to know who I'm helping, and love to see people in 3rd world countries with an entrepreneurial spirit, investing in their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a freelancer in the creative field, making websites, graphic design, 3D visuals and working for architecture offices.

lenders.name: North Hampton School, NH
lenders.loan_because: Our Service Learning goal is to do something that will create a positive change in others which in turn will change us as individuals.  Kiva gives us one opportunity to do this.
lenders.occupational_info: Our school and community value Service Learning.  Every 6th, 7th, and 8th grade student participates in Service Learning at some level.  Our students volunteer at nursing homes, hospitals, non-profit day care centers, homeless shelters, animal shelters and much more.

lenders.name: Jonathan
lenders.loan_because: I think that everybody deserves a chance to work hard and make a better life for their family.  If the desire and capabilities are there, access to capital should not be a limiting factor.

lenders.name: Ferran Arricivita
lenders.loan_because: It's better to give than to receive!
lenders.occupational_info: I work in Webmasters Without Borders nonprofit in Perú.

lenders.name: Hector
lenders.loan_because: I love people
lenders.occupational_info: I help people to see the life in a good way

lenders.name: Ellie
lenders.loan_because: I see the abundance in life!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Law of Attraction Life Coach - My passion is helping others to understand and utilize the Universal Law of Attraction in their daily lives.

lenders.name: Sergio
lenders.whereabouts: Santa Cruz de Tenerife Santa Cruz de Tenerife

lenders.name: Matt Gantner
lenders.loan_because: I want to help disadvantaged people improve their lives in a meaningful way.
lenders.occupational_info: I assist business in building websites and other media.

lenders.name: Mark Hodder
lenders.loan_because: I want to support other Entrepreneurs who don't have access to the same benefits as I have had in Canada. As my own business grows I want to help others grow their own businesses around the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people do business on the internet.

lenders.name: aquilax
lenders.occupational_info: Mostly creative

lenders.name: Jasmine
lenders.loan_because:
Each of you should give as you have decided in your heart to give. You should not be sad when you give, and you should not give because you feel forced to give. God loves the person who gives happily. 
2 Corinthians 9:7
lenders.occupational_info: I am a full time student at my University. I will graduate in 2010 and plan to become an attorney.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: it puts a smile on a couple of faces.
lenders.occupational_info: a bit of teaching ... a lot of learning ... and a little loving ...

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.loan_because: I know how harsh other people can be, especially when you have got a very good idea, but no money!
lenders.occupational_info: Sales & production of natural or recycled plastics. Sales of natural disinfectants & insecticides. This is my cat, Galileo, he is a purple point British shorthair purring furry hot water bottle!

lenders.name: Alan
lenders.loan_because: I want to give others a chance to pursue their dreams and accomplish their goals.
lenders.occupational_info: I help administer a fellowship that allows students to study language intensively overseas.

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage contracts and change orders for a construction company.

lenders.name: Keelan
lenders.loan_because: i want to help others reach their full potential

lenders.name: Antonio
lenders.loan_because: People in need deserve the chance to get a loan to make better their quality of life. I really believe in microcredit as a strong tool to help people around the world  to improve their lives.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: If not me, who?

lenders.name: Pierre
lenders.loan_because: I've lived in third world countries and have seen extreme poverty first hand. My mother suffered under the khmer rouge, who annihilated Cambodia's once prosperous economy. I also believe market-based solutions to development to be the most sustainable and effective from an economic point of view, and that micro-finance is on the right track!
lenders.occupational_info: I am currently studying management and economics. Eventually I hope to start my own business as well. And then it will be my turn to look for financing.. Maybe you can help me then, when you're wealthy? ;-)

lenders.name: Ketari
lenders.loan_because: Is the least we can do
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a traditional bank that lends only to those who already have money

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because: As someone who has their own business, I like the idea of helping others make their business grow.
lenders.occupational_info: I develop web sites for small business owners, solo-preneurs and non profit organizations.

lenders.name: Suzanne
lenders.loan_because: I believe that microfinance is an invaluable tool in developing businesses and economies across the globe, providing people in less advantaged situations the opportunity to provide for themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Muneer
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people raise themselves into affluence.

lenders.name: Lindsay
lenders.loan_because: "he who is kind to the poor lends to the Lord, and He will reward him for what he has done" (prov 19:17)
lenders.occupational_info: I study Music, French, and African culture at New York University. I am also a musician - I write music, play guitar & violin, and sing!

lenders.name: Miguel Ángel
lenders.loan_because: I think it is a very good way to make possible a long-term improvement around the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I design computer applications for my regional goverment.

lenders.name: Jen Grier
lenders.occupation: Game Designer / Sound Designer / Tech Support
lenders.loan_because: I like empowering people!
lenders.occupational_info: I make sounds for video games and other interactive media.  I'm also a composer and saxophonist.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I believe this is one area in which I can demonstrate God’s love to all people, by aiding those who need financial assistance, helping those who are in a time of need.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and build things.  Projects may include buildings, airports, shops, schools, restaurants, furniture, etc.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.occupation: Physician(Homeo), Chairman of JEEVAN SAGAR TRUST.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I like to help people in need find success.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell services that help companies engage their customers and build their business.

lenders.name: Nicholas MacGowan
lenders.loan_because: Having lived in Africa, I know what a difference it can make. I also see it as a better way to help people in developing countries than charity. My hope is that entrepreneur can grow a sustainable business, and in the best case, even create jobs. Best of all, these people don’t feel like a charity case, they know they have to work hard to pay back the money. Having started several companies myself, I know what a difference that can make, not only to your self-esteem, but also to your work effort. Plus, knowing that others believe in you is a fantastic feeling.
lenders.occupational_info: Currently, I work at twidox, which I co-founded. Twidox is a free, user generated online library of ‘quality’ documents and other media that allows individuals and organisations to easily publish, share and search for them.

lenders.name: André
lenders.loan_because: I can.
